title: Release 4.2.4
body: [bot] Release wasmer version 4.2.4

title: fix(docs): add cpp in Chinese
body: add cpp in Chinese

title: Add `application/wasm` to list of accepted content-types for webcs
body:
-------

When downloading a webc file, accept files with `application/wasm` header as
well.
The backend sets `Content-Type: application/wasm` header on webc files in the
object storage, so they can have dynamic compression enabled on them.
This makes downloading them faster by enabling `Accept-Encoding: gzip` when
downloading the file.

title: deps: Bump edge-cli
body:
Contains a bug fix for `wasmer app create`, which would
previously fail due to not appending `wasmer.toml` to the manifest path,
and trying to use a directory path instead.

Closes #4330

title: use rusty_pool instead of rayon
body:
Uses `rusty_pool` instead of `rayon` as the thread pool implementation.

Resolves #4311, #4320, #4201.

Most likely resolves #4094.

title: Fix visibility validation to work when publishing a new package
body: Fixes #4329.

title: Add `--wait` and `--timeout` flags to `wamer publish`
body:
## The `--wait` flag
Rationale: When a large package is published, the user has to wait for a while to
be able to use it. This is because the webc of the package is not available on
the registry until the package is fully processed.

The registry now supports passing a wait flag to the publish query. This will
cause the query to wait until the webc of the package is available on the
registry before exiting. By default, this is set to false (for backwards
compatibility), and the `--wait` flag on the CLI enables it.


## The `--timeout` flag

Rationale: When publishing a large package with the `--wait` flag - it may take a long
time.

The `--timeout` flag can be used to set the timeout for http requests made while
publishing the package. This is important because processing large webc files
may take a while. The default timeout is set to 30 seconds, but can be increased
if necessary (e.g. when publishing large packages).


## Example usage:

```
wasmer publish --wait --timeout 120s && wasmer run <package-name>
```
Since the package is immediately available, the above command is possible.

title: Always re-execute a registry query when cache lookups fail
body:
Fixes #4288.

The underlying problem is that we would always assume that a cached query to the backend is correct, so we wouldn't notice a newly published version. This rearranges the logic so any cached query that doesn't match a version constraint will force us to re-query the backend.

title: deps(cli): Upgrade Edge CLI
body:
Upgrade to newest Edge CLI version.

This improves the "app create" templates, and fixes some small bugs
related to app creation workflows.

Note: the CLI crate was renamed from wasmer-deploy-cli to wasmer-edge-cli.

title: Bump min enumset version to 1.1.0
body:
# Description

The symbol `enumset::__internal::EnumSetTypeRepr` used in wasmer-types was only made public in 1.1.0:
https://github.com/Lymia/enumset/compare/v1.0.13...v1.1.0

In order to ensure a project embedding Wasmer does not use incompatible enumset versions ^1.0.0, < 1.1.0 we should bump the version here to the actual min required version.

title: Add TTY aware output to the wasmer package and wasmer container commands
body:
Adds:
- [x] Better messages with emojis for the commands implemented in #4287 
- [x] Adds a progress bar for the command `wasmer package download`

title: fix(cli): Prevent temporary file issues in "package download"
body:
tempfile::NamedTempFile s can not be moved between different file
systems.

Many OSes create temporary files on a separate file system, which leads
to errors when downloading.

This commit changes things to just use a regular file instead.

title: Fix for the non-flushing of file descriptors and a nasty deadlock
body: Closes #4303

title: Revert "When the main thread was exiting it was not flushing and properly closing file descriptors"
body: Reverts wasmerio/wasmer#4293 (please see #4303)

title: refactor(cli): run: Unify wasi env setup
body:
Unify the setup of the WasiEnv.
Previously there were different setup paths for running plain .wasm
files and for running packages.

This required some modifications to the WasiRunner, but only a
reasonable amount.

This also brings some additional improvements:

* Allow customizing the current_dir , both in the WasiEnvBuilder and in
  the WasiRunner
* Properly validate and merge --dir and --mapdir flags

title: Use authentication when running a package
body:
As part of private packages and #4247, we want to make sure API tokens are sent to the backend when doing `wasmer run some/private-package`.

We'd like the CLI to automatically figure out which token to use while not sending API tokens to random endpoints, so updated `WapmSource` (the component that queries the Wasmer registry when looking up packages) to accept an API token for its registry and modified `BuiltinPackageLoader` (the component for downloading those packages) so it has a hashmap of hostnames to API tokens that it will consult when downloading a `*.webc` file.

title: fix: prevent potential UB by deriving repr C for union
body:
# Description
Use repr C for `VMFunctionContext` to prevent undefined behavior. I believe this union may exhibit UB since it [crosses an FFI boundary](https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/blob/d18aa794978e6b951e36632e29e58f4ef7e0da03/lib/vm/src/trap/traphandlers.rs#L642-L670). Also, I think `eq` and `is_null` may be called on both instances of the union despite the layout not being guaranteed. This is explained further [this](https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#/default_union_representation) by this clippy lint so perhaps it's worth configuring it to be `deny`.

title: Terminate after flushing file descriptors
body: This patch will modify the behavior of a closing WASM process so that it only sends the termination signal after `stdout` and `stderr` are flushed.

title: When the main thread was exiting it was not flushing and properly closing file descriptors

title: feat(cli): Add package commands
body:
Adds new CLI commands for working with packages:

* package download: download package from registry
* package build: build a package from a wasmer.toml manifest
* package unpack: extract package contents to a directory

title: Ignore all create_exe tests as part of #4285
body:
The integration tests for `wasmer create-exe` are some of our flakiest tests, often requiring us to re-run CI 2 or 3 times just to make it pass. This has a massive impact on velocity and developer experience in the Wasmer repo, and weakens our overall trust in Wasmer's test suite.

This PR disables those flaky tests in CI until the code can be made more reliable or the tests can be moved out of the main CI flow for the Wasmer repo (see #4285).
 
The `wasmer create-exe` functionality isn't used too much just yet, with the only known user being the Wasmer registry backend. That means if anything breaks and causes `wasmer create-exe` to no longer work at all, our dev environment should notice it pretty quickly and alert us.

title: fix: Fix async runtime mismatch in virtual "wasmer run" command
body:
The virtual "wasmer run" command available in wasix was switched to a
inline waker for resolving the future, but it calls
BinaryPackage::from_registry, which needs to run in a tokio runtime, due
to doing web requests for package retrieval.

Easily fixed by delegating to the main runtime.

Closes #4269

title: Add support for publishing private packages
body: This updates the `wasmer publish` command to allow users to publish private packages. When a package is private, you will only be able to access it if you have contributor access (e.g. because you are the owner, have been added as a contributor, or are part of a namespace that owns the package).

title: Use write instead of send for pipe, to accomodate socketpair
body:
Use write instead of send for pipe, to accomodate socketpair.

Because C socketpair use fd_pipe to create the pair, waist pipe will need to handle `sock_send`

title: Allow packages to have commands that use a dependency's atom
body: This is the `wasmer` counterpart to https://github.com/wasmerio/pirita/issues/172 and https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer-toml/pull/22, adding support for commands that can use atoms from a dependency.

title: Bump the MSRV from 1.69 to 1.70
body:
The `clap` crate upgraded its MSRV from `1.64` to `1.70` when releasing `v4.4.0` (https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/pull/5086).  That is forcing the `webc` crate to bump the MSRV for its workspace, which in turn forces us to bump the Wasmer repo's MSRV.

I've also included an integration test which will make it easier to keep the MSRV in sync in the future. The idea is to automatically detect files you've forgotten to bump the MRSV for, update them, then fail the test with a `"lib/wasi-web/Cargo.toml" was not up to date and has been updated. Please commit the changes and re-run the tests` message. The MSRV value is all driven from the `rust-version` in our root `Cargo.toml` file.

I've also added the `--locked` flag to all commands in the Makefile. That way, when CI does a build or runs tests, it is guaranteed to use the exact versions mentioned in `Cargo.lock`, and can't automatically use newer versions.

title: Ignore `fd_close(3)` to avoid breaking POSIX programs that blindly close all file descriptors
body:
This adds a hack that ignores `fd_close(3)` so POSIX programs that blindly close all file descriptors other than stdin/stdout/stderr don't lock themselves out of the filesystem.

See @ptitSeb's troubleshooting [on Slack](https://wasmerio.slack.com/archives/C02CK7101PG/p1694591219376609) for more context.

It's pretty difficult to write tests for WASIX syscalls at the moment, so I'm just going to test manually.

title: Rephrase the docstring for `--forward-host-env` flag on `wasmer run`
body:
The doc in `wasmer run --help` for this flag says that it should only work for wcgi tasks, but it works for other packages as well.

This commit changes the doc to reflect that.

title: feat(wasix): Add BuiltinPackageLoader::insert_cached
body:
Can be useful when needing to load custom webcs that bypass
the backend.

title: Fixes for sockets
body:
- Disabled DONTROUTE which was breaking networking
- Removed some potential race conditions on the handlers being registered at the wrong times
- Removed the unsafe code and replaced it with a token system
- Implemented a `poll` call for host based networking which better represents reality
- Implemented a unit test so that this does not happen again

title: Remove StdioMode::Reserved variant
body:
# Description
Removes redundant `StdioMode` variant to make it match the `wasix-abi-rust` definition.

title: Fix File System Merging Problems
body:
fix: Prevent invalid file system merging errors

This commit changes the EmptyFileSystem read_dir() and metadata() implementation
to always return an empty stub when trying to read the root path "/".

This is done because some code paths expect the root to always be
readable.

This also makes sense thematically, because an empty file system should
still be readable, just not contain any files.

This fixes bugs related to file system union/merging logic.

Also adds a regression test.

title: Stability improvements
body:
- Reduced some excessive logging
- Fixed an issue with the polling loop
- Added more socket option flags for WASM sockets

title: Replace stack pool mutex with lock-free queue
body: Alternate implementation of #3922 using a lock-free queue instead of thread locals. I benchmarked this by creating 100 threads and running a simple WASM function in a loop 30,000 times in each thread. This PR reduces the total time by ~75% on my 10-core CPU, and does not create meaningful impact on single-threaded performance. Also, since the queue is shared among threads, there is no risk of high memory consumption in highly concurrent scenarios.

title: Fix sockets
body:
A couple of small fixes to sockets:

* Fixed endianness issue when deserializing IPv6 addresses that caused swapped bytes in each `u16`.
* Fixed receiving data from UDP sockets that have not been connected to a remote socket (i.e. server sockets).

title: More fixes to support Wasmer JS
body:
This PR adds a couple extra fixes that are needed to make `wasmer-js` work.

- Replace the `wasm_bindgen_downcast` crate with our own implementation because `Symbol`-based type checking isn't thread safe - this meant we corrupt the heap if a trap is raised on one thread and consumed from another (e.g. via `WasiRuntimeError::as_exit_code()`)
- Fixes some broken links which get rejected by `clippy` when compiling to `wasm32-unknown-unknown`

title: Fix invalid access to wasi instance handles in wasix proc_spawn
body:
# Description
Fixes `wasix` `proc_spawn` implementation by removing redundant attempt to retrieve memory from the uninitialized `inner` handle.

title: Early check that a cached artifact is compatible with current CPU Features
Add stdin/stdout/stderr streams to `WasiRunner` and only use async threading when requested
body:
While working on https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer-js/pull/328, I noticed that we don't have a way to intercept the stdin, stdout, and stderr streams of a `WasiRunner`. 

I've also made it so we only use async threading when it is explicitly requested. Using async threads in the browser triggers #4158 because it uses things like `task_dedicated()` and `resume_wasm_after_poller()` which may smuggle `!Send` types to background threads.

title: Allow `VirtualTaskManager` to explicitly transfer a module to a blocking task on the threadpool
body: We need a way to explicitly transfer a `wasmer::Module` to tasks running on the threadpool. Using `VirtualTaskManager::task_dedicated()` will capture the value which means we'll hit #4158 when running in the browser.

title: NativeEngineExt::deserialize now returns Module
body:
This is done to make the result actually usable, because there is no
public constructor that allows going from Artifact to Module.

Followup to #4139

title: Faster compiles for debug by using release version of cranelift
body: Uses the release version of cranelift for debug as it takes about 5 mins for basic WASM apps on my machine without it.

title: Js integrity checks
body: This PR introduces integrity checks to detect thread-safety issues in the `wasmer` crate when the `"js"` feature is activated and compiling in debug mode.

title: Make sure vmoffset are aligned to pointer size (for #4059)
body:
Make sure vmoffset are aligned to pointer size.

This should help #4059

title: Fix writing to middle of files and improve performance
body:
This PR fixes writing to the middle of temp FS files. The current behaviour slices the buffer and inserts the new buffer in the middle. This is in contrast to the behaviour of normal file systems where writing to the middle of a file overwrites existing data. As a consequence of this fix, there is no longer a performance issue either.

Closes #3903.

title: deps: Bump Edge client CLI to 0.1.22
body:
Fixes a bug where the "app create" command would not create a wasmer.toml
if the package wasn't published immediately.

Improves output.

Adds a "wasmer app info" command for getting high-level app info.

The "app get/info" commands will now infer the app from an app.yaml in
the current directory.

Closes #4128

body: Bumped virtual-net crate to 0.5.0

title: Revert "0-copy module deserialization"
body:
Reverts wasmerio/wasmer#4139

(to be merged after 4.1.2 is released)

title: fix: Make the "wasmer cache" command use the same cache directory as the rest of the CLI
body:
It turns out the `wasmer cache` command was using a `crate::common::get_cache_dir()` helper to get the cache directory, but that helper isn't actually used by anything else (they all use `wasmer_registry::wasmer_env::WasmerEnv`) and automatically appends the current version number to `$WASMER_DIR/cache`.

That means `wasmer cache clean` would try to delete `~/.wasmer/cache/4.1.1` while the rest of the runtime was saving things to `~/.wasmer/cache/compiled`, `~/.wasmer/cache/downloads`, and so on.


Fixes #4093.

title: Disable auto-format of toml files in VS Code
body: This PR disables auto-formatting of toml files in VS Code. This has been known to cause PRs to be difficult to review.

title: Test virtual-net bincode and mpsc only on linux
body: CI-Test virtual-net "bincode" and "mpsc" only on linux, it's not implemented on Windows or macOS

title: fix(cli): Prevent panics in "wasmer login" after API failures
body:
Previously login_and_save_token() was called from an async context.
Since the function uses a blocking reqwest client for the internal
GraphQL query, this could lead to panics when the API query failed, due
to the blocking reqwest tokio runtime trying to shut down inside another
tokio runtime, which is not allowed.

This is fixed by running login_and_save_token() inside a spawned thread.

Closes #4147

title: Web http client
body: This introduces a web HTTP client that uses JavaScript's `fetch()` API.

title: 0-copy module deserialization
body: Closes #3882. This change lets modules be loaded directly from archived structs by adding traits that are implemented by both plain and archived versions of structs used in modules.

title: Upgrade wasmer-wasix to the newest version of wasm-bindgen
body:
This fixes a bunch of nasty version conflict issues downstream.

```console
$ cargo check
    Updating crates.io index
error: failed to select a version for `wasm-bindgen`.
    ... required by package `wasmer-wasix v0.10.0`
    ... which satisfies dependency `wasmer-wasix = "^0.10"` of package `wasmer-wasix-js v0.0.1-alpha.1 (/Users/work/Documents/wasmer/wasmer-js)`
versions that meet the requirements `>=0.2.74, <0.2.85` are: 0.2.84, 0.2.83, 0.2.82, 0.2.81, 0.2.80, 0.2.79, 0.2.78, 0.2.77, 0.2.76, 0.2.75, 0.2.74

all possible versions conflict with previously selected packages.

  previously selected package `wasm-bindgen v0.2.87`
    ... which satisfies dependency `wasm-bindgen = "^0.2.87"` of package `js-sys v0.3.64`
    ... which satisfies dependency `js-sys = "^0.3.60"` of package `wasm-bindgen-downcast v0.1.1`
    ... which satisfies dependency `wasm-bindgen-downcast = "^0.1.1"` of package `wasmer v4.1.0`
    ... which satisfies dependency `wasmer = "=4.1.0"` of package `wasmer-wasix v0.10.0`
    ... which satisfies dependency `wasmer-wasix = "^0.10"` of package `wasmer-wasix-js v0.0.1-alpha.1 (/Users/work/Documents/wasmer/wasmer-js)`

failed to select a version for `wasm-bindgen` which could resolve this conflict
```

title: Switch to lazily loading a Wasmer package directly from disk
body:
I've switched to the latest version of the `webc` crate so we can pick up https://github.com/wasmerio/pirita/pull/143. 

This will avoid the performance penalties of creating a temporary `*.webc` file every time we do `wasmer run .` (particularly obvious when actively working on something like a Wordpress site).

title: fix(wasix): Expose FileSystemMapping struct
body:
The FileSystemMapping struct used in package resolution code is not
currently public, preventing users from implementing the `Source` trait
outside of this crate.

This was overlooked during the initial merge of this feature.

title: Enable tokio's "net" feature in the virtual-net crate
body:
# Description

The `virtual-net` crate forgot to enable Tokio's `net` feature whenever `host-net` is enabled, so it won't compile by itself. 

That seems to be what caused `make test-build-docs-rs` to fail on `master`... We only discovered this missing feature flag because #4064 told docs.rs to activate the `host-net` feature, and that test iterates through each crate and builds it with the same feature flags and `--cfg=docsrs` that docs.rs would use. 

This fixes #4066.

title: deps: Upgrade edge CLI version
body: Notable change: wait until webc is ready before publishing an Edge app.

title: Enable the `cfg_doc` feature on docs.rs
body:
# Description

This PR makes sure docs.rs enables the `doc_cfg` and `auto_doc_cfg` features (see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/43781) when generating documentation.

I was checking this locally using the following command:

```console
$ RUSTFLAGS="--cfg=docsrs" RUSTDOCFLAGS="--cfg=docsrs" cargo +nightly d --package=wasmer-wasix --open
```

It doesn't 100% work for the `wasmer` crate because the way we use `#[cfg]` to switch between backing implementations screws things up, but the other crates with simpler conditional compilation stories are documented as expected. I'm not *too* concerned though, because #4033 will fix things properly.

Fixes #4039.
